Dalanzadgad is the base for explorations into the
. With black smoke coming from the power station, and its dust roads, it's not a very interesting town by itself, but it's a good place to stock up with food for your excursion into the desert.
There is a pretty fast and efficient daily bus from

at 08:00 and 16:00 (about 12 hours, 22.000T). It leaves at the bus station which you can reach by the Electrobus #4 (is that Dragon Center?).

Minibuses ("Porgons") leave from the

"Black Market" (Narantuul Zach) when they are full (that means, really full: 16 people!), usually in the afternoon between 12:00-17:00 and cost around 30.000T. Expect frequent breakdowns and up to 24h traveling time.

The airport serves workers at several large mines nearby and generally uses larger planes than other domestic flights in Mongolia. A new paved runway was built in 2007 that is the 2nd longest in Mongolia after Chinggis Khaan International.

value: hours=Office Hours: 09:00-18:00 Everyday except Sat and Sun
content= It is generally cheaper, but uses older planes. Charges foreigners double the local rate. Flights everyday of the week during summer.
content=Uses newer planes, but more expensive than AeroMongolia. Flights 7 days a week during peak summer period.
directions= Located in Building of Golomt bank
content= Recently changed its name from Mongolian Airlines. Flights to Ulaanbaatar everyday of the week during summer, and Mon, Wed, and Fri during winter.

There are a few good supermarkets in town.

value: content=Probably the best address for independent travellers, this is a great place to hook up with the few fellow travelers to share a jeep into the desert. The friendly (french-speaking) owners can help you organize drivers. You sleep in a four-bed Ger. Great pizza and also a good place for a drink and a chat.
Dalanzadgad is surrounded by the Gobi Desert
